file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-29-03-04 - GALLEY LIGHTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL GALLEY LIGHTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the galley light lamps, galley light assemblies, and galley lamp holders. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 33-29-03-000-801-A GALLEY LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL ALL 33-29-03-400-801-A GALLEY LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION ALL 33-29-03-000-802-A GALLEY LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL GALLEY LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLA- ALL 33-29-03-400-802-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-29-03 Page 1 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-29-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. GALLEY LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the galley light lamps. (2) This task is applicable to the removal of the forward/aft galley fluorescent lamps (installed on the service-door region ceiling panel) and the outboard galley fluorescent lamps (installed on the main-door region ceiling panel). (3) Four fluorescent lamps are installed in the forward/aft galley light assembly. (4) Two fluorescent lamps are installed in the outboard galley light assembly. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 233 233ALC Main-door region ceiling panel 234 234ARC Service-door region ceiling panel C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Open these circuit breakers and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tags to them. (a) GALLEY LIGHTS on the RH power control and distribution box (Location tip: RB GND SERV BUS 2/GALLEY LIGHTS). (b) AFT GALLEY on the RH power control and distribution box (Location tip: RB SHED DC BUS 2/AFT GALLEY). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-29-03 Page 2 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-004-A (1) With a screwdriver (3), loosen the four Dzus fasteners (4) to remove the lens (2) from the ceiling panel (1). (2) Hold the lamp (5) and use a deploy tool (6) to eject it. (3) Carefully remove the fluorescent lamp (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-29-03 Page 3 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH OUTBOARD GALLEY Galley Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 233 B 1. CEILING PANEL EXIT OUTBOARD GALLEY (REF.) DET. A C 5. FLUORESCENT LAMP 5. FLUORESCENT LAMP 4. DZUS FASTENER (4) 3. SCREW DRIVER 7. LAMP HOLDER 2. LENS 6. DEPLOY TOOL DET. B DET. C SK145AMM330008A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-29-03 Page 4 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Galley Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 402 A ZONE 234 AFTER B STANDARD GALLEY (REF.) FORWARD STANDARD GALLEY (REF.) FWD 1. CEILING PANEL DET. A C 5. FLUORESCENT LAMP 5. FLUORESCENT LAMP 4. DZUS FASTENER (4) 7. LAMP HOLDER 2. LENS 3. SCREW 6. DEPLOY DRIVER TOOL DET. C DET. B SK145AMM330009A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-29-03 Page 5 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-29-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. GALLEY LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the galley light lamps. (2) This task is applicable to the installation of the forward/aft galley fluorescent lamps (installed on the service-door region ceiling panel) and the outboard galley fluorescent lamps (installed on the main-door region ceiling panel). (3) Four fluorescent lamps are installed in the forward/aft galley light assembly. (4) Two fluorescent lamps are installed in the outboard galley light assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-29-00-700-801-A/500 GALLEY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 233 233ALC Main-door region ceiling panel 234 234ARC Service-door region ceiling panel D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-004-A (1) Engage the contacts of one fluorescent lamp (5) end in the lamp holder without locking mechanism. Then, push the contacts of the other end in the lamp holder (7) with locking mechanism to lock it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-29-03 Page 6 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: Two lamp holders hold each fluorescent lamp. Only one lamp holder has locking mechanism. (2) Put the lens (2) in position and tighten the Dzus fasteners (4). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-004-A (1) Remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tags and close these circuit breakers. (a) GALLEY LIGHTS on the RH power control and distribution box (Location tip: RB GND SERV BUS 2/GALLEY LIGHTS). (b) AFT GALLEY on the RH power control and distribution box (Location tip: RB SHED DC BUS 2/AFT GALLEY). (2) Do the operational test of the galley lights ( AMM TASK 33-29-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-29-03 Page 7 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-29-03-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. GALLEY LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the galley light assembly. (2) This task is applicable to the removal of the forward/aft galley light assembly (installed on the service-door region ceiling panel) and the outboard galley light assembly (installed on the main-door region ceiling panel). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-803-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-29-03-000-801-A/400 GALLEY LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 233 233ALC Main-door region ceiling panel 234 234ARC Service-door region ceiling panel D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-005-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) (For EMB-145() MODELS) Remove the main-door region ceiling panel or service-door region ceiling panel, as applicable (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-29-03 Page 8 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) (For EMB-135() MODELS) Remove the main-door region ceiling panel or service-door region ceiling panel, as applicable (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400). (4) (For EMB-135SL MODELS) Remove the main-door region ceiling panel or service- door region ceiling panel, as applicable (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-803-A/400). (5) Remove the galley light lamp ( AMM TASK 33-29-03-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 403) (Figure 404) SUBTASK 020-005-A (1) (For aircraft with outboard galley) For removal of the outboard galley-light-assembly, disconnect the connector (6) from the ballast (5). Refer to Figure 403. (2) For removal of the forward/aft galley-light assembly, disconnect the two connectors (6) from the two ballasts (5). Refer to Figure 404. (3) Remove the tiedown straps (7) that attach the harness to the ceiling panel (8). (4) Remove the screws (3) and washers (2) that attach the galley light assembly (1) to the ceiling panel (8). NOTE: The screws that attach the galley light assembly also attach the bonding jumpers. (5) Remove the galley lamp assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-29-03 Page 9 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH OUTBOARD GALLEY Galley Light Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 403 A ZONE 233 B EXIT OUTBOARD 3. SCREW (6) GALLEY (REF.) DET. A 2. WASHER (6) 1 4. BONDING JUMPER 1. GALLEY LIGHT ASSEMBLY 5. BALLAST 8. CEILING PANEL 6. CONNECTOR 7. TIEDOWN STRAP SUPPORT (2) DET. B 1 ELETRICAL BONDING (METHOD 7). BONDING DET. A JUMPER (2) 2. WASHER (6) 1. GALLEY LIGHT ASSEMBLY 5. BALLAST (2) 8. CEILING PANEL 6. CONNECTOR (2) 7. TIEDOWN STRAP SUPPORT (2) DET. B 1 ELETRICAL BONDING (METHOD 7). SK145AMM330011A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-29-03 Page 11 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-29-03-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. GALLEY LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the galley light assembly. (2) This task is applicable to the installation of the forward/aft galley light assembly (installed on the service-door region ceiling panel) and the outboard galley light assembly (installed on the main-door region ceiling panel). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ELECTRICAL BONDING TEST - STANDARD PROCE- AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200 DURES TYPES OF ELECTRICAL BONDING AND SURFACE AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200 PREPARATION - STANDARD PROCEDURES ELECTRICAL BONDING PROTECTION - STANDARD AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-802-A/200 PROCEDURES AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-803-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-29-00-700-801-A/500 GALLEY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 33-29-03-400-801-A/400 GALLEY LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION IPC 25-22-04 HEADLINER C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 233 233ALC Main-door region ceiling panel 234 234ARC Service-door region ceiling panel D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Tiedown Strap IPC 25-22-04 2 Tiedown Strap IPC 25-22-04 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-29-03 Page 12 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 403) (Figure 404) SUBTASK 420-005-A (1) Do the bonding procedure, method 7, on the assembly surface where the bonding jumpers (4) are attached (AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200). (2) Put the galley lamp assembly (1) in position on the ceiling panel (8). (3) Install the washers (2) and screws (3) that attach the galley light assembly (1) and bonding jumpers (4) to the ceiling panel (8). (4) Do the bonding test (AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200) on the galley light assembly (1). (5) Do the bonding protection ( AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-802-A/200) on the bonding jumpers (4). (6) (For aircraft with outboard galley) For installation of the outboard galley-light assembly, connect the connector (6) to the ballast (5). Refer to (Figure 403). (7) For installation of forward/aft galley-light assembly, connect the two connectors (6) to the two ballasts (5). Refer to (Figure 404). (8) Use the tiedown straps to attach the harness to the supports (7). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-005-A (1) Install the galley light lamp ( AMM TASK 33-29-03-400-801-A/400). (2) (For EMB-145() MODELS) Install the ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/ 400). (3) (For EMB-135() MODELS) Install the ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/ 400). (4) (For EMB-135SL MODELS) Install the ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-803-A/ 400). (5) Do an operational test of the galley lights ( AMM TASK 33-29-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-29-03 Page 13 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
